org.jcvi.jillion.sam

Class SamParserFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jcvi.jillion.sam.SamParserFactory

  • public final class SamParserFactory
extends Object
    SamParserFactory is a Factory class for creating SamParser instances depending of if the provided file is a SAM or BAM encoded file.
    Author:
    dkatzel
    API Note:

    To create a new SamParser from a Sam or Bam file: 

      
 File samFile =...
 SamParser parser = SamParserFactory.create(samFile);

      • create

        public static SamParser create(File f,
                               SamAttributeValidator validator)
                        throws IOException
        Create a new SamParser instance for the given SAM or BAM file.

        Since Jillion 5.0 if the given file is a coordinate sorted BAM file and there is an accompanying BAI file in the same directory named f.getName() + ".bai", then a specialized SamParser that uses the index will be returned as if the call to createUsingIndex(File, File, SamAttributeValidator) was used instead.

        Parameters:
        f - the SAM or BAM file to be parsed; can not be null, must exist and the file must end in either ".sam" or ".bam" (ignoring case).
        validator - the SamAttributeValidator to use to validate the SamRecords being parsed; can not be null.
        Returns:
        a new SamParser instance will never be null.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the file does not exist.
        NullPointerException - if any parameter is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the file's extension is not either ".sam" or ".bam" (ignoring case).
        See Also:
        createUsingIndex(File, File, SamAttributeValidator)

      • createUsingIndex

        public static SamParser createUsingIndex(File bam,
                                         File bamIndex)
                                  throws IOException
        Create a new SamParser instance for the Coordinate sorted BAM file with accompanying BAI encoded file and using the ReservedAttributeValidator to validate the SamRecords to be parsed. This is the same as createUsingIndex(bam, bai, ReservedAttributeValidator.INSTANCE).
        Parameters:
        bam - the Coordinate sorted BAM file to be parsed; can not be null, must exist.
        bamIndex - the corresponding BAI encoded file to be parsed; can not be null, must exist.
        Returns:
        a new SamParser instance will never be null.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the file does not exist.
        NullPointerException - if any parameter is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the file's extension is not either ".sam" or ".bam" (ignoring case).
        Since:
        5.0
        See Also:
        createUsingIndex(File, File, SamAttributeValidator)

      • createUsingIndex

        public static SamParser createUsingIndex(File bam,
                                         File bamIndex,
                                         SamAttributeValidator validator)
                                  throws IOException
        Create a new SamParser instance for the Coordinate sorted BAM file with accompanying BAI encoded file and using the given SamAttributeValidator to validate the SamRecords to be parsed.
        Parameters:
        bam - the Coordinate sorted BAM file to be parsed; can not be null, must exist.
        bamIndex - the corresponding BAI encoded file to be parsed; can not be null, must exist.
        validator - the SamAttributeValidator to use to validate the SamRecords being parsed; can not be null.
        Returns:
        a new SamParser instance will never be null.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the file does not exist.
        NullPointerException - if any parameter is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the file's extension is not either ".sam" or ".bam" (ignoring case).
        Since:
        5.0
